column4: could somebody tell me what's the partition software for kde?
could somebody tell me what's the partition software for kde?
linux itself is a lot more powerfull
I've got to compile a C program, but I have to compile it using borlan for windows
no you can't, because "CONIO.H" is not a standard ANSI C header, and it's basically only supported under MS-DOS for all i know
you don't, you use different functions
have a look at here http://www.ozzu.com/ftopic32782.html    there appears to be a conio -> ncurses wrapper (lupine_85 too, FYI)
though it gives me a 404. but search for "linux-conio-1.02.tgz" on google, finds a few
just about every program for Gnome is written in C
